text.p: The Detroit Tigers completed another trade with San Diego on Tuesday, sending pitchers Joey Eischen and Cam Smith to the Padres for catcher Brian Johnson and pitcher Willie Blair.
For Detroit, it is the sixth trade of the off-season and third involving a starting catcher in the last week.
The Tigers had dealt Brad Ausmus, who was acquired from San Diego last season, in a nine-player trade with Houston a week ago, and acquired Matt Walbeck from Minnesota a day later.

The 28-year-old Johnson has played all three major-league seasons with San Diego. In 82 games last year (59 starts), he recorded career bests of a .272 average, 66 hits, eight homers, 35 RBI and 13 doubles.

Blair went 2-6 with one save and a 4.60 ERA in 60 relief appearances, spanning 88 innings in 1996. He owns a 25-41 career record with four saves and a 4.73 ERA with Toronto, Cleveland, Houston, Colorado and San Diego.

Eischen began last year with the Los Angeles Dodgers, but was dealt to Detroit on July 31 in a three-player trade. The left-hander was 0-1 with a 4.78 ERA in 28 relief appearances with the Dodgers before posting a 1-1 mark and 3.24 ERA in 24 outings with Detroit.
Smith has compiled a 26-30 record and 4.84 ERA in four minor league seasons. Last year, he went 5-8 with a 4.59 ERA in 22 games (21 starts) in Class A Lakeland.

General manager Randy Smith came to Detroit from San Diego and has engineered three trades in less than a year with his former team. These teams also completed a major trade last June, as catcher John Flaherty and shortstop Chris Gomez were sent to San Diego for Ausmus and shortstop Andujar Cedeno.
